chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340, in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator).  Exceptions are going to court and meeting with his Atty.  No contact with the victim, LL (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 10-25-2016: Defendant may also have exceptions for vocational training with DVR and medical appointments.

AMENDED 03-06-2017: GPS MAY BE REMOVED
Review hearing on September 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demitris M Belle in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Ms. Sommers forwarded this matter for consideration for Ch. 51 or 55. Corporation Counsel has denied the request. The family is considering private counseling. The State is unable to proceed and therefore moves to dismiss. Defense does not object

BTC: proceedings are suspended. Matter to be set out 6 months. Ruling is reserved on motion to dismiss. GPS may be removed but bond remains. If the deft has no difficulties complying with bond in the next 6 months, the Court will grant the State's motion  Review hearing scheduled for September 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
